5:25 , "Some amino acids are coded for by the same codon." A  better statement would be "Some amino acids are coded for by more than one codon." - dictionary of amino acids http://www.csus.edu/indiv/l/loom/gene%20expr/codons.jpg

some astro-biologists claim that life stared with simple enzymes [maybe RNA like.... but we cannot re-produce a complete mechanism yet for that experiment as a whole], then proteins, then with mineral catalysts and extreme temperature and very acid pH RNA was formed and then tiny DNA fragments. This is not a standard process and it might kill even extremophiles. Astro-biologists try to create experiments that mimic compound evolution from asteroid creation until the Earth conditioning in a single experiment. The use as input to the "earth compound experiment" the "output" of the asteroid experiment.  Nowadays is simply a theory... Not well designed as an experiment in the lab. Few data have been found. Some data are positive but yet to not support the theory as a whole... the experiment doesn't mimic well all the variations of radiation and temperature and some claim that they do not the explosion to water method of the asteroid experiment "output"  they do not expect to find huge DNA molecules, but tiny ones, [it doesn't work well on the lab neither for tiny molecules yet, but why not to play and try???...]  i do not know what to say... it is simply a theory, not well supported yet

There's no reason or prove that it was any simpler, so it's logical to assume that it wasn't.

No matter how simple a cell might be, it is still very complex to be at random or a series of fortunate events that happened to coincide. It's more likely that an intelligent mind is behind all of this. But evolutionists will never accept this fact. And I know I'm going to get trolled for this comment, but it's the truth.
What you're seeing here is the sophisticated, very optimized stuff going on in modern cells, but there is no reason why things couldn't be much simpler in the distant past.
